page.title: 08Farming, Boreham Wood
page.content: We found 2 farms on the ordnance survey map. We visited Rowley Green Farm and found that it hadn't been a farm for some time. The man who lived there said he had 7 acres of rough grazing where he kept 4 goats and 2 horses. He was hoping to have a poultry farm and planned to keep 1,000 chickens. We also went to Strangeways Farm which has 250 acres. Grass is cultivated on most of the ground which feeds 100 horses and 16 bullocks. Silage is made to feed them in the winter. Fire destroyed all the farm buildings in 1975 when there was a dairy herd of 100 cows. The buildings have since been renewed.
